[

Information Security Engineer

Company Name MYOB Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 70 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Who Are We

We are a tech company that exists to help businesses succeed. Our team is continually growing, inventing and disrupting conventions. We believe businesses can do amazing things and it's our job to help them. This is MYOB.
We simplify, we collaborate, we find new ways to innovate, we set goals, we smash goals and we always make the call. It’s the way we do things around here. We are inspired, authentic, and in the know … This is the MYOB Way.

The opportunity

Join our Enterprise Tech Services team where you will immerse yourself within the central heart of how we empower and support our people through the technical solutions and tools. Be part of a collaborative group who cares about your career growth and development of work as well as be exposed to some complex problems that will challenge and extend your capability through new and some legacy systems.

The freedom to experiment and innovate drives the way we solve complex problems and is the central theme to everything we do here.

Reporting into the Manager Enterprise Security, you will be responsible for managing the IT Security, Risk & Compliance for MYOB’s IT Services.

As a Security engineer, you will be responsible for managing the IT Security, Risk & Compliance for MYOB’s IT Services.

As part of a small, agile and highly capable team you will take a strong hands-on approach to ensuring the secure operations of the MYOB IT systems and services.

The role
  • Provide thought leadership in the IT security area
  • Provide technical security advice and assistance to internal clients (MYOB staff)
  • Support the MYOB organisation maintain PCI-DSS compliance standards across MYOB’s technology environments
  • Continuously enable the IT organisation to deliver exceptional, secure, services through the effective use of automation, tools, process and procedures
  • Drive awareness of security threats and mitigate threats where possible.
  • Architect, build and implement security solutions to continuously improve the security state and reduce risk across the IT services organisation
  • Incident and Problem management adhering to ITIL standards
  • Participation in 24x7 on call support coverage

What You Will Bring

  • At least 5 years’ experience in managing security of enterprise production IT environment.
  • Experience in securing cloud based technology solutions.
  • Demonstrable experience in working with PCI-DSS compliance for an organisation
  • Outstanding knowledge of security principles and techniques
  • Excellent understanding and working knowledge of IT security technologies including, but not limited to
  • Data protection including encryption, PKI, SSL, FIM, AV, DLP, IDS/IPS
  • Networking security technologies across LAN / WAN including firewalls, WAF etc
  • Security tools such as qualys, snort, Nessus, kismet etc.
  • Security monitoring and alerting through SIEM platforms. Splunk experience highly desirable.
  • In depth knowledge of security standards and frameworks such as PCI-DSS, NIST, OWASP, ISO 27001 etc.
  • Excellent understanding of network technologies across both LAN & WAN

    • So it is over to you, do you want to Love Your Work? Find out more by applying now. We look forward to meeting you!

    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

    Industry

    • Computer Software

    Employment Type

    Full-time

    • Information Technology

[

Senior Security Engineer

Company Name illion Australia and New Zealand Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 132 views

Job description

About the Role

An opportunity has become available for a permanent Senior Security Engineer to join the team at illion. The Senior Security Engineer is responsible for the smooth running of the Illion security infrastructure, associated services and security projects whilst ensuring IT security procedures and documented and repeatable and that policies are implemented and adhered to as laid out by the IT Security team.


You will be responsible for:

  • The role is responsible for the provision of technical expertise across the enterprise, including maintaining network availability and security and performance across DBA's network system, by resolving network and security related issues to meet SLAs.
  • Deliver operational effectiveness and documented processes for the End Point DLP, Password Access Management, BeyondTrust, WAF, Voice/Data networks and other environments and resolve problems across the infrastructure including network, servers, telephony, desktop and security service.
  • Accurate Reporting of weekly and monthly performance metrics across the Illion security posture is essential to this role.


About You

The ideal candidate will have the following skills:

  • Planning and management capability, including project management core disciplines
  • Experience with security & network technologies such as Firewalls, Routers, Switches etc
  • Hands on experience with management of IT Security Operations and development of team capabilities
  • End to end Infrastructure and App Dev management experience, in large, complex enterprises
  • Exposure to IT Security Projects
  • Effective leadership, coordination, negotiation and dispute resolution skills
  • Exceptional stakeholder engagement skills including strong influencing and relationship skills and the ability to liaise and partner closely with internal business unit leaders
  • Strong influencing, relationship and negotiating skills, with the ability to liaise across the business and with external industry stakeholders
  • Flexible, responsive and ability to lead and manage change
  • Demonstrable commercial acumen
  • Exceptional verbal and written business communication skills
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Ability to multi-task, co-ordinate project activities, prioritise and meet deadlines
  • Strong commercial acumen
  • Track record of successful performance in an intense and dynamic environment Exposure to WAF & SIEM an advantage
  • High Level of exposure with large, complex voice and data networks


The ideal candidate will have the following experience:

  • High level of experience with Security & Networking technologies
  • Experience in configuring and managing Cisco & Checkpoint firewalls, Cisco Router ACL's, configuring and managing Cisco & Checkpoint VPN protocols and Technologies.
  • Strong knowledge on Microsoft Server technologies, IIS, TCP/IP & WAN and Internet Technologies.
  • Strong Network fault analysis and diagnostic skills (Packet analysis, Syslog, Firewall logs)
  • Certification Requirements (minimum)
  • Cisco Certified Network Administrator (CCNA)
  • Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP)
  • Eligibility to hold Australian Government Baseline Security Clearance
  • Experience in an IT Security function within the financial services industry and a knowledge of products associated with credit reporting, collections and marketing services
  • Knowledge of ISO 27001, IRAP, PCI-DSS and other associated standards
  • \xa0'Hands on' application of core Project Management competencies
  • PMBoK/PMP/PRINCE2/AGILE/Waterfall qualification or similar qualification
  • Worked within technology driven by Agile and Waterfall software development methodologies
  • Experience in running stand ups and using Kan Ban methodology to manage workflows
  • Superb Microsoft Office skills particularly Excel, Word, Powerpoint and Project
  • Familiarity with JIRA and Confluence
  • Tertiary degree in Business or Computer Science would be well regarded.

This exciting opportunity provides the successful applicant with the opportunity to take the next step in their career, working on iconic and complex projects both locally and internationally, and with the potential to further enhance their professional development.

Our strategic approach in achieving sustainable growth and employee driven success is supported by our focus on developing and maintaining strong client relationships in line with our core operating values. \xa0It is therefore critical that candidates are aligned with our strong, team focused, culture.

852077843:
[

Senior Python Developer

Company Name Leica Biosystems Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 37 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Due to continued growth, we are currently recruiting for an experienced Senior Software Engineer and a Mid-Level Software Engineer with commercial Python experience to join our software team.

This is an excellent opportunity for a motivated software engineer to join a medical device company and help improve patient outcomes.

You will be working on a large business critical project that will impact millions of people’s lives.

As a Senior Python Developer you will be responsible for but not limited to
  • Design, Develop and Test software in compliance with the applicable standards and regulations
  • Investigate and analyse software related issues
  • Develop and contribute to technical documentation
  • Define technical procedures
  • Maintain & configure development and test environments
  • Provide technical leadership for other software engineers
  • Provide detailed effort estimates for software design implementation.
  • Provide feedback through development reviews

About You

Successful candidates will meet the following mandatory requirements, and some of the desirable requirements (depending on experience level).

Key Skills/experience Required
  • Expert knowledge of writing Python and using associated tools (in a professional capacity)
  • Graduate or post-graduate qualifications in Computer Science or Software Engineering (or equivalent qualification)
  • A Minimum of 7+ years’ experience in Software Development including exposure to the full software development life cycle
  • Implementation experience with software development technologies subject to project needs.
  • Experience in software solution design including experience in applying Object Oriented Analysis and Design techniques and patterns.
  • Experience in developing applications using one of Microsoft Platforms (including Windows Desktop & Server), Linux or RTOS environments
  • Experience in the use of Configuration Management Systems such as Git and Subversion.
  • A solid understanding of the software development life cycle and applicable best practice design control procedures including experience in applying Object Oriented Analysis and Design techniques.
  • Strong verbal, documentation and communication skills.

Highly Favourable Skills
  • Experience in Software development in a regulated environment (e.g. IEC62304, DO-178B or similar)
  • Design documentation using UML
  • Experience with Continuous Integration servers (e.g. Jenkins, TeamCity)
  • Familiarity with Agile, Scrum and Lean methodologies

Benefits
  • Be a part of something that matters - We offer an opportunity to work on products that change people’s lives.
  • A flexible fast paced working environment and a positive culture with teams that support each other.
  • We also have a structured career development program, an employee recognition scheme as well as a competitive remuneration package and bonus.

To Apply

You must be an Australian citizen or a holder of an Australian Permanent Residency visa to be eligible to apply for this position.

Leica Biosystems is committed to attracting and retaining the most highly qualified candidates available. We firmly believe that our employees drive the success of the company. With success in mind as the ultimate goal, we strive to create and provide an environment that offers challenging, stimulating and financially rewarding opportunities. As a Leica Biosystems employee you will be consistently challenged to deliver your best.

If you are ready for this challenge, submit your resume for consideration. http//www.leicabiosystems.com/about/careers/

Be sure to follow Leica Biosystems on LinkedIn!

Leica Biosystems is a global leader in workflow solutions and automation. As the only company to own the workflow from biopsy to diagnosis, we are uniquely positioned to break down the barriers between each of these steps. Our mission of “Advancing Cancer Diagnostics, Improving Lives” is at the heart of our corporate culture. Our easy-to-use and consistently reliable offerings help improve workflow efficiency and diagnostic confidence. The company is represented in over 100 countries. It has manufacturing facilities in 9 countries, sales and service organizations in 19 countries, and an international network of dealers. The company is headquartered in Nussloch, Germany. Visit LeicaBiosystems.com for more information.

Danaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide. Our world class brands are leaders in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including life sciences, medical diagnostics, dental, environmental and applied solutions. Our globally diverse team of 67,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our competitive advantage. We generated $18.3B in revenue last year. We are ranked #162 on the Fortune 500 and our stock has outperformed the S&P 500 by more than 1,200% over 20 years.

At Danaher, you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate. Our brands allow us to offer dynamic careers across multiple industries. We’re innovative, fast-paced, results-oriented, and we win. We need talented people to keep winning. Here you’ll learn how DBS is used to shape strategy, focus execution, align our people, and create value for customers and shareholders. Come join our winning team.

853838210:
[

e-Learning Content Developer

Company Name The Royal Australian College of General Practitioners (RACGP) Company Location 100 Wellington Parade , East Melbourne, VIC 3002, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 57 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Australia’s largest professional general practice organisation
  • Part Time (0.8), 12 month Fixed Term Contract
  • $72,491 per annum plus 13.5% super, based in East Melbourne


The Royal Australian College of General Practitioners (RACGP) is Australia's largest professional general practice organisation and represents over 38,000 members working in general practice. The RACGP's activities focus on the six key areas of standards, quality, education, advocacy, professional leadership and collegiality.

\xa0
The position
\xa0
The RACGP’s Education Development team is looking for an e-Learning Content Developer to provide high-quality, evidence-based online activities and resources to GP’s at each stage of their educational journey. Reporting to the Education Development Manager you will be using the latest technology to primarily support the Practice Experience Program (PEP) and contribute to ad hoc and BAE projects including gplearning in the Development team.
\xa0
Your responsibilities will include:


  • Development of online learning activities and associated multimedia using material supplied by the Instructional Designers and/or Projects Officers including updates from medical educators.
  • Provide support to assist integration and implementation of newer functionality and / or improvements to the LMS for existing and / or future projects.
  • Assist internal stakeholders ensuring that reporting requirements are met and share LMS knowledge as required.
  • Carry out other relevant duties as requested by the Education Development Manager.
\xa0
\xa0
The candidate
\xa0
You will have excellent written and verbal communication skills combined with high level attention to detail and organisation skills. Working in a small team strong customer focus is essential combined with an extensive working knowledge of appropriate e-learning applications \xa0 A basic knowledge of CSS, XML and javascript would be ideal with prior experience in the LMS content development environment.
\xa0
Any experience working within an education or health-related organisation would be highly regarded.
\xa0
\xa0
What’s in it for you?
\xa0
You will be joining a high-profile health and education organisation where progressive leadership, innovation, integrity, collaboration and accountability is valued. Benefits of working at the RACGP include 13.5% superannuation, easy access to public transport at a great location opposite the MCG, annual leave loading, additional leave over the Christmas and New Year period and discounts to a large range of retailers.
\xa0
In 2017 the RACGP became a winner in the Employer of Choice Award category within the Australian Business Awards. The Employer of Choice Award recognises achievement through effective recruitment, engagement and retention of staff.
\xa0
\xa0
To apply for this position, please click on the ‘apply’ button and submit your covering letter expanding on your skills and experience and your CV. Please ensure that your application is submitted in one PDF or Word document. Applications will only be accepted if they are submitted online.
\xa0

Applications close AEST 11:55pm – Wednesday September 19, 2018
\xa0
\xa0
The Royal Australian College of General Practitioners is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications are encouraged from people with a disability, people who identify as Australian Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander peoples, mature age and people from culturally diverse backgrounds. Candidates must have the right to work in Australia.
